title: [K-12] Project-Based Elementary Mathematics Training Course Utilizing Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics basic computational skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division)
context.additional_context: A blended online-offline learning environment using digital devices (tablets/laptops), applying mathematical concepts to solve real-world problems.

learning_goals: Learners can apply mathematical concepts to real-world problems by completing two weekly projects in a blended learning environment.
Learners engage in collaborative activities, exchanging peer evaluations and feedback using digital tools (apps/platforms) with at least 80% proficiency.
Learners achieve a score of 80 or above in a summative assessment, demonstrating mathematical problem-solving skills acquired through blended learning.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
